channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Shonda Rhimes used to feel a disconnect between her and her characters
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Grey's Anatomy" creator Shonda Rhimes talks about why she doesn't care about validation.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. "Grey's Anatomy" creator Shonda Rhimes talks about why she doesn't care about validation.

item.title: A neighbor's Christmas gift that keeps on giving
item.description: In the days leading up to Christmas 2018, the Williams family were told that their neighbor had passed away. He left behind a sack of 14 gifts for Cadi Williams to be opened each year on Christmas.
item.content:encoded: In the days leading up to Christmas 2018, the Williams family were told that their neighbor had passed away. He left behind a sack of 14 gifts for Cadi Williams to be opened each year on Christmas.
item.dc:creator: John Ketchum

item.title: The real ping pong champion — and hustler — who inspired 'Marty Supreme'
item.description: Marty Reisman was nicknamed "The Needle" for his slender physique. He dressed well and put on a show.
item.content:encoded:
Marty Reisman was nicknamed "The Needle" for his slender physique. He dressed well and put on a show.

(Image credit: Ed Ford)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Springsteen's label was about to drop him. Then came 'Born to Run'
item.description: Biographer Peter Ames Carlin describes the making of Born to Run as an "existential moment" for Springsteen. Carlin's book is Tonight in Jungleland. Originally broadcast Aug. 7, 2025.
item.content:encoded: Biographer Peter Ames Carlin describes the making of Born to Run as an "existential moment" for Springsteen. Carlin's book is Tonight in Jungleland. Originally broadcast Aug. 7, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: 50 years later, a journalist reunites with 'Santa Claus' Jewish newspaper boy
item.description: In 1967, a journalist wrote about a boy buying presents on Christmas Eve. The story got an overwhelming response from readers. Fifty years later, the young boy and the journalist reconnected.
item.content:encoded: In 1967, a journalist wrote about a boy buying presents on Christmas Eve. The story got an overwhelming response from readers. Fifty years later, the young boy and the journalist reconnected.
item.dc:creator: Robin Washington

item.title: NPR listeners share their untraditional holiday traditions
item.description: Holiday traditions don't all come with matching sweaters and cookie recipes — some are stranger, funnier, and deeply personal. We asked our listeners to share their unconventional holiday traditions.
item.content:encoded: Holiday traditions don't all come with matching sweaters and cookie recipes — some are stranger, funnier, and deeply personal. We asked our listeners to share their unconventional holiday traditions.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: A man is making gingerbread houses to extreme proportions and lengths
item.description: Peter Williams makes highly elaborate gingerbread houses. He's depicted San Francisco's Painted Ladies and zoo, as well as a replica of the International Space Station.
item.content:encoded: Peter Williams makes highly elaborate gingerbread houses. He's depicted San Francisco's Painted Ladies and zoo, as well as a replica of the International Space Station.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: Reindeer bring holiday magic to Illinois ranch year round
item.description: Reindeer typically live in colder climates. However, they are a big hit on a ranch in central Illinois where they live year-round and become a special attraction during the holiday season.
item.content:encoded: Reindeer typically live in colder climates. However, they are a big hit on a ranch in central Illinois where they live year-round and become a special attraction during the holiday season.
item.dc:creator: Adelyn Mui

item.title: Here to Help: Volunteering on Christmas Day
item.description: The Washington, D.C., Jewish Community Center has designated Dec. 25 as a day of service. On Christmas Day, hundred of volunteers fan out, offering food, gifts, warm clothing for those in need.
item.content:encoded: The Washington, D.C., Jewish Community Center has designated Dec. 25 as a day of service. On Christmas Day, hundred of volunteers fan out, offering food, gifts, warm clothing for those in need.

item.title: 30 years ago, 'Waiting to Exhale' was the blockbuster Hollywood didn't anticipate
item.description: The 1995 adaptation of Terry McMillan's novel celebrated the beauty of Black sisterhood.
item.content:encoded:
The 1995 adaptation of Terry McMillan's novel celebrated the beauty of Black sisterhood.

(Image credit: Merie W. Wallace)
item.dc:creator: Carole V. Bell
